abstract: After passing a bill that would block regulations on cement plants, House Republicans immediately turn to a companion measure stymie rules on toxic emissions from industrial boilers and incinerators.
snippet: After passing a bill that would block regulations on cement plants, House Republicans immediately turn to a companion measure stymie rules on toxic emissions from industrial boilers and incinerators.
lead_paragraph: Continuing their largely symbolic attacks on the Environmental Protection Agency's rulemaking authority, House Republicans pushed through a bill on Thursday to block the agency's proposed effort to reduce airborne emissions of dangerous chemicals from cement manufacturing plants.

headline.main: House Votes to Delay Emissions Rule
